title: Tokens and Chat Format
text:
Python

import os
import openai
import tiktoken  # tokenizer
from dotenv import load_dotenv, find_dotenv
_ = load_dotenv(find_dotenv())  # read local .env file

openai.api_key = os.environ['OPENAI_API_KEY']

title: Tokens and Chat Format
text:
Helper function

def get_completion(prompt, model="gpt-3.5-turbo"):
    messages = [{"role": "user", "content": prompt}]
    response = openai.ChatCompletion.create(
        model=model,
        messages=messages,
        temperature=0,
    )
    return response.choices[0].message["content"]

title: Chat Format and Tokens
text:
Standard completion

Prompt the model and get a completion


response = get_completion("What is the capital of France?")



print(response)



The capital of France is Paris.

title: Chat Format and Tokens
text:
Tokens

response = get_completion("Take the letters in lollipop \
and reverse them")
print(response)



The reversed letters of "lollipop" are "pillipol".



‚Äúlollipop‚Äù in reverse should be ‚Äúpopillol‚Äù

title: Chat Format and Tokens
text:
Explicit tokens

response = get_completion("""Take the letters in \
l-o-l-l-i-p-o-p and reverse them""")






response



'p-o-p-i-l-l-o-l'

title: Tokens and Chat Format
text:
Helper function (chat format)

Helper function for chat format



def get_completion_from_messages(messages,
                                 model="gpt-3.5-turbo",
                                 temperature=0,
                                 max_tokens=500):
    response = openai.ChatCompletion.create(
        model=model,
        messages=messages,
        temperature=temperature,  # this is the degree of randomness of the model's output
        max_tokens=max_tokens,  # the maximum number of tokens the model can ouptut
    )
    return response.choices[0].message["content"]

title: Chat Format and Tokens
text:
Message example Sokrates

messages = [
    {'role': 'system',  # overall tone/behavior of assistant
     'content': """You are an assistant who\
 responds in the style of Sokrates."""},
    {'role': 'user',
        'content': """write me a very short poem\
 about a happy student at Hochschule der Medien Stuttgart """},
]

title: Tokens and Chat Format
text:
Response

response = get_completion_from_messages(messages, temperature=1)
print(response)



Oh, happy student amidst the halls,
In Hochschule der Medien's academic thralls,
With spirits high and mind engaged,
In pursuit of knowledge, never disengaged.

The books, the lectures, the friends so bright,
Illuminate the path, brought into sight,
In Stuttgart's embrace, where dreams take flight,
A student's joy, forever igniting the light.

The journey unfolds, challenges faced,
But with passion and fervor, they are embraced,
For in each class and project profound,
Wisdom and joy intertwine, astound.

Oh, happy student, strong and wise,
In Hochschule der Medien, aspirations rise,
May your days be filled with learning's delight,
In Stuttgart's embrace, forever ignite.

title: Chat Format and Tokens
text:
Message example one sentence

messages = [
    {'role': 'system',
     'content': 'All your responses must be \
one sentence long.'},
    {'role': 'user',
     'content': 'write me a very short poem\
 about a happy student at Hochschule der Medien Stuttgart'},
]

title: Tokens and Chat Format
text:
Response

response = get_completion_from_messages(messages, temperature=1)
print(response)



In Stuttgart's halls,
Joyous student whispers,
Learning bliss embraces.

text:

# combined

    {'role': 'system',
     'content': """You are an assistant who \
responds in the style of Sokrates. \
All your responses must be one sentence long."""},
    {'role': 'user',
     'content': """write me a very short poem\
 about a happy student at Hochschule der Medien Stuttgart"""},
]

title: Tokens and Chat Format
text:
Response

response = get_completion_from_messages(messages, temperature=1)
print(response)



In studious bliss, Hochschule's embrace,
A student's heart, alight with knowledge's grace.

title: Tokens and Chat Format
text:
Helper function

Show how many tokens you are using


def get_completion_and_token_count(messages,
                                   model="gpt-3.5-turbo",
                                   temperature=0,
                                   max_tokens=500):

    response = openai.ChatCompletion.create(
        model=model,
        messages=messages,
        temperature=temperature,
        max_tokens=max_tokens,
    )

    content = response.choices[0].message["content"]

    token_dict = {
        'prompt_tokens': response['usage']['prompt_tokens'],
        'completion_tokens': response['usage']['completion_tokens'],
        'total_tokens': response['usage']['total_tokens'],
    }

    return content, token_dict

title: Chat Format and Tokens
text:
Example message

messages = [
    {'role': 'system',  # overall tone/behavior of assistant
     'content': """You are an assistant who\
 responds in the style of Sokrates."""},
    {'role': 'user',
        'content': """write me a very short poem\
 about a happy student at Hochschule der Medien Stuttgart """},
]

response, token_dict = get_completion_and_token_count(messages)

title: Tokens and Chat Format
text:
Response

print(response)



Oh, a student at Hochschule der Medien Stuttgart,
With joy in their heart, their passion unfurled.
In lectures they learn, their minds ever bright,
Seeking knowledge, embracing the light.

Amongst fellow scholars, they find their place,
Sharing ideas, with smiles on their face.
In libraries they delve, books as their guide,
Expanding horizons, with each page they stride.

With professors as mentors, guiding their way,
They grow and they flourish, day after day.
In projects they thrive, creativity soars,
A happy student, forever exploring new shores.

Oh, Hochschule der Medien Stuttgart, a place so grand,
Where dreams are nurtured, where futures expand.
A happy student, forever grateful, they'll be,
For the knowledge gained, and the memories set free.

title: Tokens and Chat Format
text: Intuition

title: Tokens and Chat Format
text:
What is a token?

The GPT family of models process text using tokens
Tokens are common sequences of characters found in text
The models understand the statistical relationships between these tokens, and excel at producing the next token in a sequence of tokens.

title: Tokens and Chat Format
text:
How long is a token?

One token generally corresponds to ~4 characters of text
This translates to roughly ¬æ of a word (so 100 tokens ~= 75 words).

title: Tokens and Chat Format
text:
Tokens vs words

‚Äúlollipop‚Äù in reverse should be ‚Äúpopillol‚Äù



response = get_completion("Take the letters in lollipop \
and reverse them")
print(response)



The reversed letters of "lollipop" are "pillipol".

title: Tokens and Chat Format
text:
Create single tokens

response = get_completion("""Take the letters in \
l-o-l-l-i-p-o-p and reverse them""")






response



'p-o-p-i-l-l-o-l'

title: Tokens and Chat Format
text:
tiktoken

tiktoken is a fast open-source tokenizer by OpenAI.
Given a text string (e.g., ‚Äútiktoken is great!‚Äù) and an encoding (e.g., ‚Äúcl100k_base‚Äù), a tokenizer can split the text string into a list of tokens (e.g., [‚Äút‚Äù, ‚Äúik‚Äù, ‚Äútoken‚Äù, ‚Äù is‚Äù, ‚Äù great‚Äù, ‚Äú!‚Äù]).
Encodings specify how text is converted into tokens.
Different models use different encodings.
